name: Beef and Beet Borscht
author: Chef John
summary: It was this soup that started my lifelong love of adding sour cream to things. The way the tangy, rich cream melts into the hot, beefy broth is a wonder to behold.
ingredients: 1 (1 inch thick) slice bone-in beef shank
¼ cup white vinegar, or to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste
2 tablespoons chopped fresh dill, for garnish
directions: Cook beef shank in a large soup pot over high heat until browned, about 3 minutes per side; add water, onion, carrots, celery, and bay leaf to the pot, bring to a simmer and cook until meat is tender and falling off the bone, about 4 hours
Combine beef broth, beets, and cabbage in a large soup pot; cook, stirring occasionally, until beets are tender, about 30 minutes
Reduce heat to low; add vinegar, salt, and black pepper
Serve garnished with sour cream and dill
